posts.title: The Ultimate Guide to Angkor Wat Sunrise
posts.excerpt: Everything you need to know about experiencing the magical sunrise at Angkor Wat, from timing to photography tips.
posts.author: Sarah Chen
posts.content:
Why Angkor Wat Sunrise is Special

Watching the sunrise at Angkor Wat is one of the most iconic travel experiences in the world. As the first light hits the temple towers, the sky becomes a canvas of gold, pink, and purple.

Best Time to Arrive

  • Arrive at least 4:45 AM – 5:00 AM
  • Sunrise typically happens between 5:40 AM – 6:10 AM
  • High season crowds arrive earlier

Best Photography Spots

The most popular location is the left reflecting pool, which captures a mirror-like reflection of the temple. Bring a tripod if possible.

Tips for a Great Experience

  • Carry a flashlight for the dark entrance
  • Bring water – it's hot even early in the morning
  • Wear comfortable walking shoes

Whether you're a photographer or a casual traveler, the sunrise view is unforgettable.

posts.title: A Culinary Journey Through Khmer Cuisine
posts.excerpt: Discover the rich flavors and unique dishes that make Cambodian food one of Southeast Asia's hidden gems.
posts.author: David Kim
posts.content:
Introduction to Khmer Cuisine

Cambodian food is a blend of ancient traditions, fresh ingredients, and bold flavors. It reflects the country's culture, history, and strong connection to the land.

Must-Try Dishes

  • Fish Amok – creamy curry steamed in banana leaves
  • Lok Lak – stir-fried beef served with lime-pepper sauce
  • Nom Banh Chok – Khmer noodles with fresh herbs
  • Prahok – fermented fish paste used in many traditional dishes

Flavors of Cambodia

Khmer cooking balances sweet, sour, salty, and bitter flavors, often using lemongrass, kaffir lime, turmeric, and fresh herbs.

Eating Like a Local

Visit morning markets to experience Cambodian cuisine at its freshest. Street food stalls in Phnom Penh and Siem Reap offer great options for travelers.

posts.title: Siem Reap: Beyond the Temples
posts.excerpt: Explore the vibrant markets, local cafes, and hidden gems that make Siem Reap more than just a gateway to Angkor.
posts.author: Emma Thompson
posts.content:
Siem Reap Has More Than Just Angkor Wat

While Angkor Wat is the star attraction, Siem Reap is full of unique experiences that travelers often overlook.

Top Things to Do

  • Explore Old Market (Psar Chas) – souvenirs, spices, and street snacks
  • Coffee at local cafés – try coconut coffee or Khmer iced latte
  • Visit Artisans Angkor – handmade crafts and workshops
  • Take a bike ride through the countryside

Nightlife & Entertainment

From night markets to live music bars, Siem Reap has a lively scene after sunset. Many restaurants offer traditional Apsara dance shows.

Hidden Gems

Try exploring the rural villages around Siem Reap for a quiet, authentic experience away from the crowds.

posts.title: Life on Water: Tonle Sap's Floating Villages
posts.excerpt: An intimate look at the unique communities living on Southeast Asia's largest freshwater lake.
posts.author: Michael Nguyen
posts.content:
A Lake That Changes Everything

The Tonle Sap is one of the most extraordinary lakes in the world, expanding and shrinking dramatically with the seasons.

Floating Villages

Communities such as Kampong Phluk and Chong Kneas live entirely on the water. Homes, schools, and shops float with the movement of the lake.

Daily Life on the Lake

  • Fishing is the main livelihood
  • Children commute to floating schools
  • Boats act as taxis and delivery vehicles

Why Visit?

A trip to the floating villages offers a deep cultural experience and insight into Cambodia’s connection to the lake.

posts.title: Photography Tips for Cambodia
posts.excerpt: Capture the beauty of Cambodia with these essential photography tips from sunrise temples to bustling markets.
posts.author: Lisa Park
posts.content:
Best Light for Photography

Cambodia's golden hours—sunrise and sunset—are perfect for capturing temples and landscapes.

Top Photography Locations

  • Angkor Wat – sunrise shots are iconic
  • Bayon Temple – incredible stone faces
  • Tonle Sap – dramatic reflections on water
  • Phnom Penh markets – colorful and lively

Practical Tips

  • Always carry extra batteries
  • Protect your camera from dust
  • Ask before photographing locals

With the right timing and technique, Cambodia offers endless photographic inspiration.

posts.title: Kep & Kampot: Cambodia's Coastal Escape
posts.excerpt: Discover the laid-back charm of Cambodia's southern coast, from fresh crab markets to pepper plantations.
posts.author: James Wilson
posts.content:
A Relaxing Southern Getaway

Kep and Kampot offer a peaceful escape from Cambodia's busy cities, known for seafood, riverside views, and lush green mountains.

Things to Do in Kep

  • Visit the famous Kep Crab Market
  • Enjoy fresh seafood by the sea
  • Relax at quiet beaches
  • Explore Kep National Park hiking trails

Exploring Kampot

  • River cruises with sunset views
  • Pepper plantations—home of world-famous Kampot pepper
  • Bokor Mountain – historical buildings and cool climate

Together, Kep and Kampot offer the perfect mix of nature, culture, and food.
